questions.question: Never ……………………. seen such a mess.
questions.description: When the sentence begins with a negative word, we use an inverted word order.

questions.question: I look forward to …………………… from you.
questions.description: We use an ing form after look forward to.

questions.question: The faster you walk …………………… you reach home.
questions.description: The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: ………………….. being ill, she went to work.
questions.description: Either in spite or despite can be used here.

questions.question: It is time you ………………….. a better job.
questions.description: We use a past tense after it's time to refer to present.

questions.question: I haven’t got many friends but …………………… I have are close to me.
questions.description: The few means not many but all of them.

questions.question: Having …………………… her homework, she went to bed.
If I knew his address, I ……………………. write to him.
You are ill. You had better …………………….. rest.
questions.description: The first of the verb is used after had better.

questions.question: I would rather you ……………………. home.
questions.description: The past tense is used after would rather + noun.

questions.question: He studied so well that he ………………….. the first rank.
